Job Title: Engineering Intern

Location: Lansing, MI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Description

We are a global leader in automotive seating because of our people — a team of adventurous thinkers and passionate high performers who make it all possible. We pride ourselves on being at the vanguard of new industry trends and technologies. When you join Adient, you’ll play an important role in helping us improve the experience of a world in motion.

At Adient, we care about your character just as much as your qualifications. Because for us, it’s more than the job. It’s about committing to your responsibilities. Creating a global community and empowering your teammates. That’s why we work hard to ensure our employees — no matter their race, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, pregnancy, caste, disability, union membership, ethnicity, religious beliefs or the stage of their careers — can see the difference their work makes for our customers and their consumers around the globe.

Duties

Maintains updated Operator Description Sheets at all stations on the manufacturing floor.Update Plant Floor Drawing in AutoCADCreates Production Setup Procedures at all applicable equipment on the manufacturing floor.Conducts time studies to establish performance standards and line balancing requirements.Assists in managing all assembly processes relating to the manufacturing procedures.Keeps abreast with the latest in control technology and safe work practices.Responsible for ensuring that all assembly processes comply with BWI ergonomic standards.Recommends and initiates modifications of replacement of equipment that fail to meetOperating Standards.Performs other duties deemed necessary by the Manufacturing Engineering Manager.3d printing knowledge

Other Position Requirements

Must be currently enrolled in an accredited university and working towards a 4 year B.S. degree in Engineering.Available to work up to 40 hours per weekMinimum overall GPA of at least 3.0.Previous internship or co-op experience in automotive related position an added plusCAD experience CATIA or Unigraphics an added plus.Solid analytical skills and work effectively with customers, suppliers, and the development team.Strong verbal and written communication skills; attention to detail, organization skills and follow upProficient in MS Office

PRIMARY LOCATION

Bridgewater Interiors IV

Experience Level (if available): Internship
